column4: Hello, I was wondering perhaps someone could help me out with something? ...
I got this new Hedgehog 5.something build of Kubuntu and when I try to run the i386 or AMD64 liveCDs I get 2 distint problems.
On the AMD64 one, the system stops responding at trying to read the hardware clock
I read a thread about it and saw no fix
On the i386 front, X comes up and it's all vertical colored lines. I can move the mouse and see different corruption or kill X but no output appears and I can't find the problem.
None of this happens in Debian.
I cannot explain any of this at all .. everyone else seems to just grab the CDs and run with it. No such luck for me.
No one even replies, or says hello, here, #kubuntu, or the forums :(
for the X problem I would try the vesa driver for your video card. It ususally works on most video cards (not very well tho)
your using the warty live cd ?
change your video driver to vesa in /etc/X11/Xorg.conf and try starting X again
this is going to be in the ramdisk? I can edit it?
your i386 is a live cd ?
just do an install dude it's easier to fix that way and only takes about 25 mins
are there any options under the help option in the Live CD. That sounds like something that could be done as a commandline option @ boot
there is none use sudo -s in console
